job_title: Business Development Representative in New Orleans, LA
pros: Flexible, thorough training, knowledgeable leaders, supervisors always willing to assist their employees to ensure they have adequate resources and time management to complete tasks
cons: Demanding and stressful. Data input and CRM system needs updating. Excessive screen time with multiple reports weekly. Paid Salary but expected to work at least one weekend out the month and weekly night rotation in addition to 8 hour day.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Harahan, LA
pros: Good co-workers, nice neighborhood, pay is decent
cons: Short staffed, high acuity, poor training & management

job_title: Program Director in New Orleans, LA
pros: The Eating Disorders Treatment Center at River Oaks has been around for decades and provides top tier treatment. You won't find better a better clinical team. If you're interested in helping individuals through some of the toughest times of their life, as well as learn about the intricacies of this specialty population, I highly recommend applying to be an RN, tech, or therapist. Not only can one gather knowledge about Eating Disorders, there is also the specialty Trauma Program (The New Orleans Institute) which again, provides top level care and has been a part of the hospital for over 20 years. These two units are on top of general psychiatric unit, detox unit, children and adolescents. Basically, you can get any number of experiences at River Oaks.
cons: Just like within any system, there will always be barriers. However, the leading employees at River Oaks (from all disciplines) are skilled at identifying these barriers and working on solutions. I spent my pre-licensed years at River Oaks, left for an opportunity elsewhere, and came back because I needed to be around others who could problem solve.

job_title: Psychiatric Counselor in New Orleans, LA
pros: Love the patients at river oaks
cons: Pay, overnight shift, no bonuses or raises

review_title: Requirements from campus management aren't evenly distributed and are impossible standards for a hardworking employee.
job_title: Technician in New Orleans, LA
pros: helping others, self-fulfilling job, nice campus
cons: clicks and hazing practices can be unnecessarily problematic for a new worker trying to learn the job. Management in the front office and the back does not work off of the reality, or see the reality, of a staff members contributions and willingness to do their jobs correctly.

review_title: Wonderful company that provides a rewarding career!
job_title: Behavior Therapist in New Orleans, LA
pros: Working on the Clinical Services team at River Oaks Hospital has been one of the most rewarding experiences of my therapeutic career. I've had the opportunity to be on an elite multidisciplinary team, a company that supports positive work culture and promotes ethical values!
cons: I have no complaints! Wonderful facility

job_title: Registered Nurse in New Orleans, LA
pros: Good pay. Supervisors are knowledgeable and caring.
cons: High census and low staffing. Always trying to staff”to the grid” but never taking into consideration potential problems and needing extra staff.

job_title: Licensed Master Social Worker in New Orleans, LA
pros: Predictable, consistent, reliable, time consuming
cons: Ratio of Social Worker to patient is too high. Burnout comes quickly

job_title: RN Supervisor, Weekends, Former Nurse Manager/Dual/Diagnosis Program in New Orleans, LA
pros: Many older long time employees, very dedicated, competent ,professional, adequate benefits.
cons: Pay is not competitive, new CEO is incompetent and a bully, only interested in filling the beds and making money, cares nothing for patient and staff safety , staffing is inadequate and dangerous , frequent turnover of staff, especially new staff.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in New Orleans, LA
pros: Staff is friendly and helpful.
cons: Not enough support staff for safety
